intro: Hieracium narbonense, commonly known as the Narbonne hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium narbonense is often found in southern Europe, including parts of France, Italy, and Spain.
